title: The tradesman's complaint upon the hardness of the times, deadness of trade, and scarcity of money. Wherein he sighs and makes great moan, how trading is (almost) fled and gone: he intreats all men in each degree, for help in this his want and misery. To the tune of, In summer time, &c. Or, Phancies phoenix.
publisher: Printed for J. Conniers, neer the Marshalses in Southwark.,
